{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3491224,"name":"","username":"SirFire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sirfire/{size}/222590_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T00:23:23.601Z","cooked":"

We’re helping another team with their swerve but we’ve never worked with MAXSwerve before. Im pretty sure this unconnected port in the photo is the Rev Through Bore encoder, correct? Where does it connect? They dont seem to have any extra wires but they’re not sure

20250123_1617201920×2560 265 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T00:24:24.488Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":23,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":140.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483308,"topic_slug":"need-help-with-maxswerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551"},"post_url":"/t/need-help-with-maxswerve/483308/1","custom_user_title":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3491249,"name":"SndMndBdy","username":"SndMndBdy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T00:49:47.520Z","cooked":"

That’s correct. It is meant to connect to the encoder port on the SparkMax that is powering the Neo 550 that rotates the module. You’ll need to use a cable like this:

REV Robotics

JST PH 6-pin Extension Cable - 30cm

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 4

The kit should have included the cable and the adapter board to attach to the Spark Max

Okay perfect, thanks so much. Does the encoder cable from the Neo 550 just remain disconnected then?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T16:08:46.019Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":26.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":483308,"topic_slug":"need-help-with-maxswerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551"},"post_url":"/t/need-help-with-maxswerve/483308/4","custom_user_title":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3491686,"name":"","username":"TyJac42","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyjac42/{size}/230279_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T16:33:45.626Z","cooked":"

No, you need to connect the neo 550 encoder cable to the spark max as normal and plug the absolute encoder adapter board into the data port on the sparkmax. The absolute encoder then connects to that adapter board.

docs.revrobotics.com

Using Encoders with the SPARK MAX | REV ION Brushless

No, they have to use an Absolute Encoder Board to connect it to the sparkmax. You may kill something if you connect it to the front port

SndMndBdy:

That’s correct. It is meant to connect to the encoder port on the SparkMax that is powering the Neo 550 that rotates the module. You’ll need to use a cable like this:

TyJac42:

No, you need to connect the neo 550 encoder cable to the spark max as normal and plug the absolute encoder adapter board into the data port on the sparkmax. The absolute encoder then connects to that adapter board.

I feel like I’m getting two different answers here, unless I’m misunderstanding. Is the breakout board necessary? In response to the first quote, that cable can’t connect to the data pin on the Spark MAX, can it?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T17:24:06.900Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":61,"readers_count":60,"score":17.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483308,"topic_slug":"need-help-with-maxswerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551"},"post_url":"/t/need-help-with-maxswerve/483308/7","custom_user_title":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3491748,"name":"SndMndBdy","username":"SndMndBdy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T17:45:55.591Z","cooked":"

TyJac42 is correct. Sorry for the confusion.

The Neo 550 connects to this port using the cable built into the Neo 550:

The absolute encoder from your picture plugs into a Absolute Encoder Board:

REV Robotics

Absolute Encoder Adapter

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 10

Using this cable:

REV Robotics

JST PH 6-pin Extension Cable - 30cm

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 4

You then attach the Absolute Encoder Board into this port on the SparkMax:

I have found that later connection to be a bit loose at times, so I recommend wrapping the board and the SmartMax in electrical tape to keep in from inadvertently coming out.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T17:45:55.591Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":50.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483308,"topic_slug":"need-help-with-maxswerve","display_username":"SndMndBdy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-3326/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Absolute Encoder Adapter - REV Robotics","clicks":2},{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-3327/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"JST PH 6-pin Extension Cable - 30cm - REV Robotics","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54317,"username":"SirFire","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sirfire/{size}/222590_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20008,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/need-help-with-maxswerve/483308/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3491756,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T17:50:58.914Z","cooked":"

Just observing, you probably want to point the encoder port into the robot, unless you have some fancy corners that let the wire go out that direction. You’d rotate the encoder to bolt to a different set of holes to do this.

Perfect, I understand. Thanks for the clarity.

ngreen:

you probably want to point the encoder port into the robot

Yup, they are gonna rotate them inside.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T20:38:11.752Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":36,"readers_count":35,"score":7.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483308,"topic_slug":"need-help-with-maxswerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":20008,"username":"SndMndBdy","name":"SndMndBdy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/13edae/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551"},"post_url":"/t/need-help-with-maxswerve/483308/10","custom_user_title":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3491929,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T20:52:00.810Z","cooked":"
SndMndBdy:

I have found that later connection to be a bit loose at times, so I recommend wrapping the board and the SmartMax in electrical tape to keep in from inadvertently coming out.

Seconded. If not wrapped in tape then hot glued on the edges. Nothing worse than losing your rotation control and dragging a modules wheel around leaving skidmarks, and ruining the tread.
